title: Pediatric Fever - Febrile Seizure
pcr_text: 18-month-old female having seizure. Mother reports high fever and child stopped breathing momentarily. Rectal temp 103.5°F. BP 85/50, HR 160, RR 30, SpO2 95%.
correct_error: Febrile seizure. Support ABCs and cooling measures per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Support ABCs and apply cooling measures

options.feedback: INCORRECT! EMT-B cannot administer medications. Cooling is appropriate per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Asthma - Acute Attack
pcr_text: 8-year-old male with severe wheezing, unable to speak in full sentences. Child using accessory muscles, oxygen saturation 90%. BP 115/70, HR 135, RR 35, SpO2 90%.
correct_error: Acute pediatric asthma. Administer nebulized albuterol per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Epinephrine for anaphylaxis. Albuterol is first-line for asthma per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Anaphylaxis
pcr_text: 5-year-old female with hives, swelling, and difficulty breathing after eating peanuts. Child has EpiPen but parents unsure how to use it. BP 95/55, HR 140, RR 28, SpO2 92%.
correct_error: Pediatric anaphylaxis. Administer epinephrine auto-injector per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Epinephrine is first-line treatment. Oral meds too slow per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Diabetic Emergency - Hypoglycemia
pcr_text: 12-year-old male with altered mental status. Parent reports child is diabetic and missed lunch. Blood glucose 45 mg/dL. Child responsive but confused.
correct_error: Pediatric hypoglycemia. Administer oral glucose per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer oral glucose paste and reassess

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Oral glucose preferred for conscious patients. Glucagon for unconscious per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Foreign Body Airway
pcr_text: 3-year-old male suddenly choking on candy, unable to cough or speak. Child cyanotic with poor air exchange. BP 110/70, HR 140, RR 0, SpO2 75%.
correct_error: Pediatric foreign body airway obstruction. Perform back blows and chest thrusts per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Perform 5 back blows followed by 5 chest thrusts

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Abdominal thrusts can damage child organs. Back blows and chest thrusts per 2022 Standards.

title: Neonatal Resuscitation
pcr_text: Newborn male not breathing at birth, apneic and bradycardic. HR 60, RR 0, SpO2 60%. Meconium present.
correct_error: Neonatal respiratory failure. Provide ventilations per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Ventilations first for bradycardia. Compressions if HR <60 per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Seizure - Status Epilepticus
pcr_text: 6-year-old female having continuous seizure for 10 minutes. Child known epileptic but not taking medications. BP 120/80, HR 150, RR 30, SpO2 92%.
correct_error: Status epilepticus. Support ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Benzodiazepines require Paramedic certification. ABCs support per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Burns - Scald
pcr_text: 2-year-old female with hot water burns to chest and arms. Approximately 20% BSA burned, partial thickness. Child crying in pain. BP 105/65, HR 140, RR 25, SpO2 97%.
correct_error: Pediatric scald burns. Stop burning and cover wounds per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Stop burning process and cover with clean sheet

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Ice can cause hypothermia in children. Clean covering appropriate per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Trauma - Head Injury
pcr_text: 4-year-old male fell from playground equipment, struck head. Child vomiting and lethargic. GCS 12. BP 110/70, HR 120, RR 20, SpO2 96%.
correct_error: Pediatric head trauma. Monitor ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Monitor for deterioration. No sleep until cleared per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Dehydration
pcr_text: 10-month-old female with severe diarrhea and vomiting for 2 days. Infant lethargic with sunken fontanelles and dry mucous membranes. BP 85/50, HR 170, RR 40, SpO2 95%.
correct_error: Severe pediatric dehydration. Monitor ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Monitor vital signs and transport immediately

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Vomiting contraindicates oral intake. IV fluids needed per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Respiratory Distress - Croup
pcr_text: 2-year-old male with barky cough and stridor. Child has inspiratory retractions and appears anxious. BP 100/60, HR 140, RR 35, SpO2 92%.
correct_error: Pediatric croup. Provide humidified oxygen and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Racemic epinephrine requires Paramedic certification. Humidified oxygen per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Cardiac Arrest
pcr_text: 3-year-old female found unresponsive and pulseless. Witness reports child had been ill with fever. CPR in progress for 5 minutes.
correct_error: Pediatric cardiac arrest. Initiate CPR per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! AED not indicated for children <8. CPR first per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Drowning
pcr_text: 4-year-old male pulled from pool unresponsive. Bystander CPR for 3 minutes. Child now responsive but coughing. BP 100/60, HR 120, RR 28, SpO2 90%.
correct_error: Pediatric near drowning. Provide oxygen and monitor per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Steroids not indicated. Oxygen is primary treatment per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Abdominal Pain - Appendicitis
pcr_text: 9-year-old female with severe right lower quadrant abdominal pain. Child has nausea and fever. BP 115/75, HR 110, RR 20, SpO2 97%, temp 101°F.
correct_error: Suspected pediatric appendicitis. Monitor ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Pain medication may mask symptoms. Transport for evaluation per 2022 Standards.

options.text: Have child walk to test pain

title: Pediatric Poisoning - Ingestion
pcr_text: 2-year-old male ingested grandmother's heart medication. Child drowsy but responsive. Empty pill bottle found. BP 95/55, HR 110, RR 22, SpO2 96%.
correct_error: Pediatric poisoning. Contact poison control and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Never induce vomiting. Contact poison control per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Heat Illness
pcr_text: 5-year-old male left in hot car, confused and lethargic. Skin hot and dry, rectal temp 104°F. BP 100/60, HR 150, RR 30, SpO2 97%.
correct_error: Pediatric heat stroke. Rapid cooling and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Remove clothing and apply cooling measures
Give child ice water to drink
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Oral intake may cause vomiting. External cooling preferred per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Hypothermia
pcr_text: 18-month-old female found outside in cold weather, unresponsive with core temp 91°F. Infant rigid with slow breathing. BP 80/50, HR 60, RR 8, SpO2 85%.
correct_error: Severe pediatric hypothermia. Handle gently and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Aggressive rewarming dangerous in children. Gentle handling per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Sepsis
pcr_text: 7-year-old male with high fever, lethargy, and rapid breathing. Child has petechiae and appears septic. BP 85/45, HR 160, RR 35, SpO2 92%, temp 103.5°F.
correct_error: Pediatric sepsis. Provide oxygen and rapid transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Antibiotics require Paramedic certification. Oxygen support per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Epiglottitis
pcr_text: 4-year-old female with severe sore throat, drooling, and tripod positioning. Child has inspiratory stridor and appears toxic. BP 110/70, HR 140, RR 30, SpO2 90%.
correct_error: Suspected pediatric epiglottitis. Maintain airway and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Keep child comfortable and transport immediately

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Visualization can cause complete obstruction. Keep child calm per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Intussusception
pcr_text: 8-month-old male with intermittent screaming, drawing legs to abdomen. Infant has currant jelly stools. BP 95/55, HR 160, RR 35, SpO2 95%.
correct_error: Suspected pediatric intussusception. Monitor ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Reduction requires surgical intervention. Transport per 2022 Standards.
